definition: to rinse/to trick/to fool sb/to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
(coll.) to make fun of (sb)/to play tricks on
hot pot/a dish where thinly sliced meat and vegetables are boiled briefly in a broth and then served with dipping sauces
see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]

sentences.english: You dip the meat and vegetables in the broth and turn them around several times until they are done.
sentences.chinese: 把肉和蔬菜放在锅里涮直到熟为止就可以吃了。

sentences.english: I was hoaxed on the April Fools' Day.
sentences.chinese: 愚人节我被人涮了一把。

sentences.english: Of course, instead of "shabu" very clean.
sentences.chinese: 当然也不用“涮”得很干净。

sentences.english: She swilled the glasses with clean water.
Having finished his coffee, he swilled out the mug and left it on the draining board.
sentences.chinese: 喝完咖啡后，他涮了涮杯子然后把它放在滴水板上。

sentences.english: Having finished his coffee, he swilled out the mug and left it on the draining board.
sentences.chinese: 喝完咖啡后，他涮了涮杯子然后把它放在滴水板上。

sentences.english: Pour the dregs away and rinse the pot.
With more than 10 kinds of spices to prepare flavor, Tripes will also give you surprises.
sentences.chinese: 用十多种调料配制的风味涮毛肚，也会给你带来惊喜。

sentences.english: You have to rinse the tea leaves out of the pot.
sentences.chinese: 你必须把壶里的茶叶用清水涮去。

definition: see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
quick-boil/to boil for a short time
to stew in soy sauce and spices
